title: FantasyWired.com Launches New Fantasy Sports Alert App
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/11/2015 @ 5:35 AM Companies mentioned in this article: iBus Media 
SAN DIEGO, Sept. 11, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Just in time for football season, iBus Media and FantasyWired have launched a brand new daily fantasy sports app for iOS and Android mobile devices, bringing premium daily fantasy sports (DFS) content straight to the palm of your hand. The app, which delivers all of the DFS strategy and podcast content you'll find on FantasyWired.com , is free to download from the iTunes and Google Play stores (search FantasyWired). 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150910/265460 
The most exciting new feature of the FantasyWired app is Player Alerts . The FantasyWired team will send up-to-the-minute injury, roster and player news straight to your phone, allowing you to make important lineup changes before roster lock. Never play an injured or benched player again! 
Features of the FantasyWired app include: -- Up-to-the-minute injury, roster and player news straight to your mobile device -- Customizable settings that allow you to select which alerts you want to receive -- Daily strategy and picks articles for MLB, NFL, NBA, NHL, EPL, PGA and college football -- Access to the FantasyWired MLB and NFL podcasts -- Reviews and bonus codes for the best daily fantasy sports sites in the world 
"Our team of daily fantasy sports experts already provides free strategy content every day that gives our readers an edge over the competition," said FantasyWired editor-in-chief Brett Collson. "With the addition of our new app with breaking news alerts, we expect FantasyWired to become a go-to mobile resource for DFS players." 
This app is the first major app launch for FantasyWired which was acquired by iBus Media earlier this year. "We're committed to building tools and content that level the playing field for the casual, and serious players who don't have hours and hours of time to research each week," iBus Media Chief Creative Officer Matthew Parvis stated. "This app does just that, giving access to the type of analysis that is typically only available behind paywalls for free. We look forward to improving, and updating the app regularly based on user needs and wants as the football season pushes forward." 
For more information on the FantasyWired app, or iBus Media please contact US@ibusmedia.com 
Download the FantasyWired App today from the iTunes and Google Play stores!
